clinical_study.brief_title: Lithium, Cord Blood Cells and the Combination in the Treatment of Acute & Sub-acute Spinal Cord Injury
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Effect of Lithium, Umbilical Cord Blood Cells and the Combination in the Treatment of Acute and Sub-acute Spinal Cord Injury : a Randomized, Double-Blinded Placebo-Controlled Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The trial is to investigate the safety and efficacy of oral lithium, intraspinal umbilical cord blood mononuclear cell transplant, and the combination in the treatment of acute and subacute spinal cord injury

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in AIS Motor and sensory scores and ASIA Impairment Scales in 48 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: Walking Index of Spinal Cord Injury (WISCI)

arm_group.description: Conventional treatment, cord blood cell transplant and placebo
Conventional treatment, cell transplant and 6-weeks course of lithium carbonate

intervention.description: Conventional treatment includes surgeries such as laminectomy, spinal decompression etc. and the medicine generally adapted to treat spinal cord injury
Cord blood mononuclear cell, 6.4 million viable cells, are transplanted into spinal cord at upper and lower edges of the injured site
Placebo tablet, orally administration of placebo for 6 weeks

facility.name: Treating Center of Spinal Cord Injury, Chinese PLA Chengdu Army Kunming General Hospital
